items.sentence: Don\'t you want to hear my side of the story?
I\'ll probably come back here again tomorrow.
I bet stuff like this doesn\'t happen to Tom.
I thought it might be better if I didn\'t go.
I thought that Tom didn\'t understand French.
I thought that you\'d forgotten all about me.
Tom didn\'t want Mary to think he was a wimp.
Tom didn\'t want to jump into the cold water.
I bought lace curtains for my bedroom window.
Can someone please tell me what\'s happening?
Tom was in a hurry so he left his bed unmade.
It\'s very easy to miss this kind of mistake.
It\'s written in pencil, so you can erase it.
I think that Tom and Mary will do that today.
I think that Tom lives somewhere around here.
I think that guy looks a little bit like Tom.
Don\'t ask what they think. Ask what they do.
Can you afford to take a holiday this summer?
Can you at least give me a chance to explain?
You needn\'t have taken an umbrella with you.
